messages.title: Liberal Democrats - Manifesto 2015
messages.content: Thinking about voting for Labour at the upcoming General Election? I urge you to think again. Two weeks ago, Labour’s Deputy Leader Harriet Harman was asked on LBC whom leaders’ debate if her party would be “tougher than the Tories on benefits.” She replied: “I’m happy to go along with that.” Rachel Reeves, Labour’s welfare spokesperson, recently said her party “does not want to represent people on benefits.” It’s shocking: people on benefits include pensioners, parents, people with disabilities, long-term ill and millions of people in work. Ed Balls, Labour’s shadow chancellor, said he’d make the same cuts as the Tories. It’s clearer than ever that Labour aren’t the party they were. They deserted their core voters decades ago and they show no sign of returning to the values and ideology they once embodied. So who should you vote for? If you want a party and a representative who will fight for a fair society and equality of opportunity for all, then vote for the Liberal Democrats.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Invest £8 billion to improve our NHS and guarantee equal care for mental health
Guarantee education from nursery to 19, and qualified teachers in classes
Cut your taxes by an additional £400 by raising the tax-free allowance to £12,500
Protect nature and fight climate change with five brand new green laws

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Harriet Harman, Rachel Reeves, Ed Balls

politicalExperience.role: Paddy Ashdown General Election Campaign Chair
politicalExperience.achievements: Equal Marriage, a global campaign to end FGM, extra money for schools in disadvantaged areas

endorsements.endorsement: None of this would have happened without Liberal Democrats progressive voices in power.

quotes.text: I'm happy to go along with that.

quotes.text: It's shocking: people on benefits include pensioners, parents, people with disabilities, long-term ill and millions of people in work.
They deserted their core voters decades ago and they show no sign of returning to the values and ideology they once embodied.

images.caption: Paddy Ashdown portrait on campaign flyer.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Your vote counts on May 7th — use it wisely.
